articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Philippines braces to evacuate its workers in Iraq, Iran
articles.description: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte ordered the military to prepare to deploy its aircraft and ships "at any moment's notice" to evacuate thousands of Filipino workers in Iraq and Iran should hostilities erupt there
articles.content: South Koreas Foreign Ministry said last week it would work to increase the security of about 1,600 of its nationals in Iraq, where they work mostly in construction sites. Indias foreign ministry spokesman Raveesh Kumar said India wasnt planning to evacuate an… [+2392 chars]

articles.author: Ishaan Tharoor
articles.title: Trump's order to kill Soleimani is already starting to backfire
articles.description: The drone strike that killed the Iranian commander may undermine U.S. influence in Iraq and has united Iranians in anger against America.
articles.content: Irans leadership vowed severe revenge, though many analysts suspect the regime will bide its time before mustering a violent reprisal. Instead, it basked in a surge of nationalist sentiment and anger at home. Less than two months ago, security forces are said… [+5404 chars]

articles.author: Carolyn Hax
articles.title: Carolyn Hax: A couple processes a plot twist differently
articles.description: After years of trying, her husband came to terms with them not having a child. But now, they are expecting.
articles.content:
Adapted from an online discussion.
Hi, Carolyn: A few weeks ago, we found out I was pregnant. I was thrilled. My husband had come to the conclusion after several years of trying that we were better off without a child. He's genuinely doing his best to adjust… [+2742 chars]
